content: foundation socks ©2025 rachel coffman there s nothing like having a strong foundation it doesn t matter what you re doing if you re foundation isn t strong you re going to struggle this is my version of a vanilla sock and the foundation i keep returning to whenever i m knitting socks i hope this pattern helps strengthen your foundation in sock knitting as well this pattern is written for the magic loop but can be adapted to your favorite sock knitting technique materials size us 1 needles for magic loop darning needle scissors stitch markers yarn 100 grams approx 400 yards of fingering weight yarn pattern uses dragon hoard yarn moondust on their myth base 75% sw merino/25% nylon 463 yards/100 grams gauge 36 stitches x 50 row = 4 / 10 cm in stockinette blocked abbrieviations k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together ssk slip slip knit sl1kw slip one stitch knitwise with yarn held in back sl1pw slip one stitch purlwise with yarn held in back p2tog purl 2 stitches together foundation socks ©2025 rachel coffman 1 cast on using your preferred cast-on method cast on 56/64/72 stitches join to work in the round with your stitches divided evenly on both needles cuff knit a 2x2 rib for 20 rounds or your preferred cuff length leg knit all the stitches for 6 5/7/7 5 from cast-on edge or your preferred leg length heel flap to work the heel flap you will only be working the back half of the total stitches and turning your work back and forth to create the square flap that will become your heel the other half of the stitches for the top of the foot will remain on hold set up knit across the top of the foot you ll now be working the heel on the second half of your stitches row 1 rs sl1pw k1 sl1kw row 2 ws sl1pw purl all stitches repeat row 1 & 2 until you have 15/17/19 slipped stitches along the heel flap edge ending with a ws row heel turn row 1 sl1pw k 14/18/20 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl1pw p 3/7/7 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1pw knit to one stitch before the gap ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1pw purl to one stitche before the gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 & 4 until all stitches have been worked you should finish at the end of an rs row if not turn and knit all stitches to get to the far left side of the rs you should have 16/20/22 stitches at the bottom of your heel foundation socks ©2025 rachel coffman 2 gusset pick up 15/17/19 stitches along the edge of the heel flap you may want to pick up an extra stitch in the gap between the heel flap and the top of the foot place your first gusset marker knit 28/32/36 stitches across the top of the foot
